intro: Gravesia albinervia, commonly known as the white-veined gravesia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, simple, and usually hairy leaves that are elliptic to ovate in shape. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
